meanings.definition: Of or relating to the writing of history.
meanings.sent1: The professor's historiographic approach to the subject made the lesson easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The book provided a detailed historiographic analysis of the events leading to the war.
meanings.sent3: The historiographic style of the documentary added a touch of humor to the serious topic.
meanings.sent4: Her historiographic interpretation of the ancient text shed new light on its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The historiographic account painted a vivid picture of the past for the readers.

meanings.definition: A work of history or a study of historical writing.
meanings.sent1: The library had an extensive collection of historiographic works on display.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in historiographic research after studying the subject in college.
meanings.sent3: The historiographic on the shelf caught his eye with its intriguing cover.
meanings.sent4: His latest historiographic delved into the lesser-known events of the era.
meanings.sent5: The historiographic provided valuable insights into the cultural practices of the time.
